articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Cattle Farm under KPA Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Cattle Farm under KPA Unit
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the July 18 Cattle Farm under KPA Unit 580.
					 The cattle farm is a large-scale stock-breeding base built thanks to the loving care of leader Kim Jong Il, who had always worked heart and soul to improve the diet of the servicepersons and civilians.
					
					 Seeing an "Anbyon cow" personally named by Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un acquainted himself in detail with its biological characteristics and rearing.
					
					 The analysis of domestically-bred "Anbyon cow", in contrast with imported cows, shows that it is a good breed with high economic efficiency in the light of unit feed and weight increment, he noted with pleasure.
					
					 It is admirable that the farm bred the cow and established a Korean-style breeding method, he said, urging the farm to set higher goals and intensify the work to breed cows of various good strains.
					
					 Then he learned in detail about the management and operation of the farm.
					
					 He praised the farm for having done a lot of things by establishing a production cycle of animal husbandry and agriculture and concentrating efforts on pasturage not only to solve the feed problem but also to increase the output of farm products.
					
					 He called for turning the farm into an educationally effective model of modernization, scientification and industrialization in stock-breeding and an icon one that shows the development of the country's livestock industry.
					
					 Stressing the need to build the structures in the farm including animal sheds and dwelling houses nicely as required by the new century and thus transform the area of the farm into another socialist fairyland, he took a benevolent measure to do so.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Fish Farm under KPA Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Fish Farm under KPA Unit
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Anbyon Fish Farm under KPA Unit 580.
					 The fish farm was built in September 1999 on the initiative of leader Kim Jong Il and it was visited by him on April 15 (the Day of the Sun), 2001 and in November, 2011.
					
					 Going round various parts of the farm, Kim Jong Un learned in detail about its reconstruction and fish production.
					
					 Feasting his eyes on the fishponds and production facilities standing in a crisscrossed manner along the spring water stream, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the farm has undergone a complete change to look neat with picturesque environment, turning into a model fish farm and an educational unit of the country.
					
					 It is desirable to have a monument depicting the tender-hearted image of Kim Jong Il erected in the compound of the farm, a result of his love for the people, and convey his feats for all ages, he said.
					
					 At the farm's combined control room, he watched carefully workers there conduct real-time computer-backed measure and control of temperature, ph value and amount of oxygen in fishponds and monitor the physiological condition of fishes by underwater cameras.
					
					 Underlining the need to put the fish farming on a scientific and modern basis in order to keep production going on a high rate, he praised the farm for having established the strict combined management system as intended by the Party.
					
					 Seeing a water filter installed in the headstream, he praised scientists and researchers of Kim Chaek University of Technology for having rendered active support to the modernization of the farm including the establishment of its combined management system.
					
					 At a hatchery, he said it is admirable that the farm has bred fries necessary for production by its own efforts and supplied them to other units by giving fullest play to its operational capacity. Seeing a gravity-fed fishpond, he said it was built well and there is no free space left in the farm.
					
					 He urged the farm to produce in larger quantity tasty and hygienically safe fish with nutritious feed by making the maximum efficient use of existing production capacity.
					
					 Calling upon the officials and employees of the farm to play a vanguard role in the development of the country's pisciculture, he said that the Party would provide the farm with necessary vehicles and equipment.
					
					 Accompanying him was KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the KPA General Political Bureau.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Kyok Sik
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Kyok Sik
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Monday sent a wreath to the bier of Army General of the Korean People's Army Kim Kyok Sik, member of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Heads of State, Government
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Foreign Heads of State, Government
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met with foreign heads of state and government in Moscow on Friday and Saturday. He took part in the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of Russia's victory in the Great Patriotic War
					 He met and had a talk with Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Cuba and president of the Council of State of the Republic of Cuba.
					
					 He courteously conveyed the greetings of supreme leader Kim Jong Un to Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					 He expressed thanks for this and asked Kim Yong Nam to convey his sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam and Raul Castro Ruz exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries and other issues of mutual concern.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam met and had a talk with Russian Prime Minister Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev.
					
					 The prime minister said the government of the Russian Federation is attaching importance to the development of relations with the DPRK government and wishes everything will go well in the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam met and exchanged greetings with the presidents of South Africa, Mongolia, Venezuela, Zimbabwe, China, Palestine, Kazakhstan, Armenia, Egypt and Vietnam, the prime minister of Slovakia and other foreign heads of state and government and the UN secretary general.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian President 
 Moscow, May 9 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin at the Grand Kremlin Palace on Friday. He visited Russia to take part in the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of Russia's victory in the Great Patriotic War. 
					 Kim Yong Nam conveyed warm greetings from supreme leader Kim Jong Un to Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin. 
					
					 Putin expressed deep thanks for this and asked Kim Yong Nam to convey his sincere greetings to Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Kim Yong Nam courteously handed over a personal letter from Kim Jong Un to Putin. 
					
					 Putin expressed deep thanks for the personal letter. 
					
					 Kim Yong Nam and Putin exchanged views on boosting the friendly relations between the DPRK and Russia, which are entering into a new higher stage, in various fields including politics, economy and culture.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Visits Central Museum of Great Patriotic War
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Visits Central Museum of Great Patriotic War
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, visited the Central Museum of the Great Patriotic War in Moscow on Sunday. He took part in the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of Russia's victory in the Great Patriotic War.
					 Kim Yong Nam and his party went round various places of the museum, being briefed on the heroic feats of the Red Army and people who played a decisive role in beating back the invasion by fascist Germany and annihilating fascism. 
					
					 Kim Yong Nam made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Back Home
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and his party returned home on Monday after taking part in the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War held in Moscow. 
					 They were greeted by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Ri Kil Song, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Thai Foreign Ministry Delegation Here
articles.content:
Thai Foreign Ministry Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Thailand led by its Vice-Minister Don Pramudwinai arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Thai Foreign Ministry Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Thai Foreign Ministry Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Thailand visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Monday.
					 The members of the delegation laid a bouquet before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 2nd national meeting of young frontrunners in noble traits visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung University Monday.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues with boundless reverence for the President and Kim Jong Il who pursued original politics of attaching importance to youth and showing love for them and trained them as reliable political reserves of the Workers' Party of Korea and a large unit of successors to the revolution, and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Participants of Meeting of Young Frontrunners in Noble Traits
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Participants of Meeting of Young Frontrunners in Noble Traits 
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials visited the lodging quarters of the participants of the 2nd National Meeting of Young Frontrunners in Noble Traits Monday.
					 Among them were Choe Ryong Hae, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Kwak Pom Gi, Kim Phyong Hae, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials concerned.
					
					 They praised exemplary officials and members of the league for having displayed beautiful traits.
					
					 They asked them to keep performing feats in carrying out the Party's Songun revolutionary cause with intense loyalty to Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: 18th Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair Opens
articles.content:
18th Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair Opens
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The 18th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House Monday.
					 Displayed at the venue of the fair are products presented by companies of the DPRK, New Zealand, Germany, Russia, Malaysia, Mongolia, Switzerland, Singapore, China, Cambodia, France, Poland, Australia, Italy, Indonesia, Viet Nam and Taipei of China.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of External Economic Relations, officials concerned, delegations of different countries and regions, diplomatic envoys of different countries and embassy officials here. 
					
					 An opening address was made by Pak Ung Sik, director of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, to be followed by a congratulatory speech by O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of External Economic Relations.
					
					 The speakers said the fair is developing as an international economic event for boosting the economic and trade relations among different countries of the world and regions and promoting economic development.
					
					 They noted that during the fair the participants would witness for themselves achievements made by the Korean people in building a economic power and conduct multilateral scientific and technical exchange in various fields. 
					
					 The participants will steadily boost cooperation in economy and trade on the principle of equality and mutual benefit in the days ahead, they noted.
					
					 The fair will last till May 14.

articles.title: DPRK-Made Geothermal Equipment Proves Effective
articles.content:
DPRK-Made Geothermal Equipment Proves Effective 
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Geothermal equipment, produced by the Ryongsong Machine Complex, is in hot demand in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 The equipment was first applied to the Greenhouse of the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute. 
					
					 Ji Chol Ryong, chief engineer of the Ryongsong Machine Complex, told KCNA: 
					
					 In hearty response to the tasks given by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the complex manufactured a number of geothermal equipment in a short period.
					
					 The geothermal pump made by our complex is capable of generating rated capacity, not affected by variation of voltage and frequency.
					
					 It can also vary the number of rotations of motor in accordance with the change of atmospheric temperature, thus consuming less electricity than others.
					
					 We installed the equipment in the Hamhung Wading Pool, making it possible to operate the pool even in winter.

articles.title: Pyongyang Electronic Medical Appliances Factory
articles.content:
Pyongyang Electronic Medical Appliances Factory
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Electronic Medical Appliances Factory in the DPRK has made varieties of advanced electronic medical appliances.
					 The factory produces more than 10 kinds of electronic medical appliances, including ultrasonic diagnosing appliance for abdomen, electronic gastroscope and digital electrocardiograph.
					
					 In this regard, Kwon Yong Il, an official of the factory, told KCNA:
					
					 The factory pushed ahead with modernization of equipment and training of skilled workers.
					
					 Now the workers can handle CNC-based tool machines.
					
					 Dozens of workers are now studying at Pharmacology College under Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering.
					
					 The products made by the factory have enjoyed popularity among local hospitals.

articles.title: Koryo Songgyungwan Academy
articles.content:
Koryo Songgyungwan Academy in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The Koryo Songgyungwan Academy of the DPRK with a long history has been making a big contribution to the development of the nation's light industry.
					 The academy succeeded in inventing a method of keeping insam undried for more than one year, while developing microbiological agents for cultivating insam.
					
					 Meanwhile, it developed a new kind of technology for calcinating ceramics.

articles.title: Korea Boasts of Long History in Magic
articles.content:
Korea Boasts of Long History in Magic
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Korea has a long history in performing traditional magic.
					 It was well evidenced by an old album published by a neighboring country 1 500 years ago.
					
					 According to historical data, the magic developed to a higher level in the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392), the first unified state of the Korean nation.
					
					 Typical of the magic pieces were the magic with fire and the one with knife.
					
					 Today magic has made a big stride forward in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S-Japan Alliance for Aggression and War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S-Japan Alliance for Aggression and War
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, U.S. President Obama said that the U.S.-Japan alliance is "helpful" not only to the two countries but to the Asia-Pacific region and the world. Chief executive of Japan Abe noted that the strong Japan-U.S. alliance meets "the interests" of the region and the world.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in an article in this regard: What Obama and Abe uttered after the two-hour talks is nothing but red herring to convince the public of "the validity" of the tightened U.S.-Japan alliance.
					
					 The alliance is a cancer-like entity as it neither gives any help to Asia-Pacific and the rest of the world nor meets the interests of the region and the world but obstructs prosperity and development and disturbs peace and security.
					
					 The recently revised "U.S.-Japan defense cooperation guidelines" proves once again the aggressive nature of the U.S.-Japan alliance.
					
					 In the guidelines the U.S. expanded the scope of activities by the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" worldwide, thus encouraging militarist Japan calling for revanchism to reinvade other countries. What the U.S. seeks is to use Japan as a shock brigade in any region of the world to encircle and contain its rivals by force of arms and realize its ambition for world hegemony.
					
					 Japan is also seeking its ulterior aim in talking about the "interests" of the U.S.-Japan alliance.
					
					 It is the avaricious calculation of the Japanese reactionaries that they should regard the U.S. as its "senior ally" and tighten the U.S.-Japan "security alliance" whether they like or not till they build military muscle strong enough to match the latter or overpower it. 
					
					 The article accuses the U.S.-Japan alliance of bringing disaster only under the hypocritical pretext of "security".

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Posing Nuclear Threat and Sparking Arms Race
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses U.S. of Posing Nuclear Threat and Sparking Arms Race
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is persistently spreading the story about "nuclear threat" from the DPRK, asserting it has "violated the NPT and harassed global peace and security."
					 U.S. Secretary of State Kerry at the recent "2015 NPT Review Conference" held in New York, pulled up the DPRK over its non-existent "nuclear threat, " blustering that it should take an action without fail to dispel the concern of the international community over its nuclear program.
					
					 What Kerry uttered is nothing but a cynical ploy of the U.S., the world's biggest nuclear weapons state chiefly responsible for nuclear proliferation, to divert the world public opinion critical of it to the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should be more responsible than other countries for the issue of nuclear disarmament as it is just the war criminal state which inflicted a nuclear disaster upon mankind for the first time in history. 
					
					 Nevertheless, it has persisted in pursuing its aggressive nuclear policy in disregard of the NPT and its obligation required by international law.
					
					 It is going to spend a trillion US dollars for modernizing its nukes for the 30 odd years to come.
					
					 It is stepping up the development and updating of its nuclear weapons while putting up the signboard of denuclearization.
					
					 It has allotted for research, development, test and manufacture of nuclear weapons the hugest funds ever since the 1950s. It is going to spend 355 billion US dollars for modernizing its nuclear warheads for a nearly decade to come.
					
					 It has built bases for producing new type weapon grade plutonium and nuclear test bases in New Mexico State and started enriching uranium in a new facility in Tennessee State. 
					
					 A spokesperson for the U.S. Department of State recently asserted that it is in line with the NPT for the U.S. to deploy nuclear weapons in NATO member states and get familiar with the technology of using them together with its non-nuclear member states.
					
					 After deploying nukes in member states of NATO in the Cold War era, the U.S. has kept them there since its demise and staged joint nuclear war drills with non-nuclear states in Europe.
					
					 No NPT provisions allow a nuclear weapons state to share nuclear weaponry and stage drills with non-nuclear states.
					
					 This not withstanding, the U.S. has insisted that the nuclear weapons deployed in NATO member states in Europe are under its permanent control and they will never be transferred to other countries, staging joint military drills with non-nuclear states of NATO for decades.
					
					 Washington's nuclear policy sparked a race for nuclear development and manufacture in the international arena.
					
					 The director of the Department for Non-proliferation and Arms Control of the Russian Foreign Ministry said at the above-said New York conference claimed that the U.S. has laid a stumbling block in the way of nuclear disarmament. He accused Washington of refusing to sign the CTBT while pushing forward the establishment of global MD system and working hard to translate its "conception of prompt global strike" into a reality.
					
					 This clearly shows what the U.S. seeks in actuality through its call for building "a world without nuclear weapons."
					
					 This being a hard reality, it is claiming that the DPRK's self-defensive nuclear deterrent to cope with its high-handed practices to stifle the DPRK by nukes is "posing a nuclear threat" to the world. This is the height of hypocrisy to mislead the world public opinion.
					
					 With no sleight of hand can the U.S. evade the responsibility as the very one which has posed a nuclear threat to the world and sparked off worldwide arms race.

articles.title: International Kothongryon Publishes April Issue of Magazine "Thongil"
articles.content:
International Kothongryon Publishes April Issue of Magazine "Thongil"
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The International United Confederation of Koreans (International Kothongryon) made public the April issue of monthly socio-political magazine "Thongil."
					 The magazine carried special write-ups to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun), illustrated with his photo.
					
					 In several articles it praised the whole life of the President as the great history of a peerless great man who founded the DPRK and built the socialist system centered on the popular masses and the history of the tender-hearted father's love for the people.
					
					 It dealt with celebrations of the Day of the Sun held in Pyongyang accompanied with photos.
					
					 It conveyed news that the 5th Conference of Training Officers of the Korean People's Army was held under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un and he had a photo session with its participants.
					
					 It gave a detailed account of the fact that he gave filed guidance to the newly built Satellite Control Centre of the National Aerospace Development Administration.
					
					 It also conveyed news that the 7th meeting of the DPRK-Russia Inter- governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology was held in Pyongyang and the opening ceremony of the year of friendship between the DPRK and Russia took place in Moscow.
					
					 It introduced the exchanges made between the delegations of the DPRK and Russia and news of activities of overseas Koreans.

articles.title: Statement of Spokesman for Disarmament and Peace Institute of DPRK FM Posted by Bodies of Peru, Brazil on Their Websites
articles.content:
Statement of Spokesman for Disarmament and Peace Institute of DPRK FM Posted by Bodies of Peru, Brazil on Their Websites
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Peru and Brazil posted on their websites on May 3 and 4 a statement issued by a spokesman for the Disarmament and Peace Institute of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					 The Peru-Korea Institute of Culture and Friendship in a preface said the spokesman issued a statement as regards the fact that the U.S. is working hard to deploy THAAD in south Korea under the pretext of "threat" from the DPRK and introduce the U.S.-led missile defense system in south Korea. It went on:
					
					 In case THAAD is deployed in south Korea, it will destroy the balance of security in the Asia-Pacific region and spark off a new arms race and escalate tension on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet authorities should stop at once deploying THAAD in south Korea, a dangerous act of destabilizing the situation on the Korean peninsula and disturbing regional and global peace and stability.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK edited a detailed gist of the statement.

articles.title: Anniversary of ARF Marked in Guinea
articles.content:
Anniversary of ARF Marked in Guinea
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A lecture on the theme of "Association for Restoration of Fatherland-first revolutionary national united front in Korea" was given and a Korean film "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" shown at a factory of Guinea on May 5.
					 A vice manger of the factory said that the Korean people have rich experience in which they formed the united front by building the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland (ARF) 79 years ago.
					
					 The association is the first anti-Japanese national united front in Korea which was founded and led by President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, he said, and went on:
					
					 He founded the association on May 5, 1936.
					
					 It was expanded into the nationwide organization in a short span of time after its founding and made great contribution to achieving the cause of Korea's liberation.
					
					 Thanks to such tradition of great national unity the Korean people could have dynamically advanced the cause of national reunification since the country was divided into the north and the south by the U.S. after the liberation.
					
					 The ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation was clarified, the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification formed, north-south summits provided and the June 15 joint declaration adopted.
					
					 Korea is sure to be reunified as long as there are the powerful weapon of the great national unity based on the rich experience gained in the national united front movement and the will of all the Koreans to thoroughly implement the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre granja de vacas 18 de Julio de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre granja de vacas 18 de Julio de EPC
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, hizo visita a la orientacion a la Granja de Vacas 18 de Julio adscrita a la unidad 580 del EPC.
					Esta granja es una gran base ganadera construida gracias al  Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien siempre se preocupaba por la mejora de vida alimentaria de los uniformados y civiles.
					
					Observando la vaca "Anbyon", denominada por el Dirigente, el Mariscal estudio en detalles su caracteristica biologica y el estado de produccion.
					
					Examinando los datos de analisis comparativo de las vacas reproducidas a estilo coreano y las otras extranjeras, se satisfizo mucho diciendo que esa vaca deviene una buena raza de gran eficacia economica tanto en las unidades de pienso y como en el aumento del peso, etc.
					
					Es loable que la granja haya reproducido nuevamente esa vaca y establecido el modo de cria y cuidado a nuestro estilo, dijo y destaco la necesidad de trazar la meta mas ambiciosa y dinamizar la labor por reproducir las vacas de buenas variedades.
					
					Seguidamente, el Mariscal se cercioro en detalles de la administracion de la granja.
					
					Evaluo que la granja ha solucionado el problema de pienso y aumentado la cantidad de produccion agropecuaria al establecer el sistema de produccion circular de pecuaria y agricultura y desarrollar activamente el pastoreo.
					
					Instruyo convertir la granja en la unidad ejemplar y educadora para la modernizacion, cientifizacion e industrializacion de la rama pecuaria y en el modelo que presenta el indice del desarrollo pecuario de la RPDC.
					
					Hay que transformar la zona de granja en el paraiso socialista al construir excelentemente segun la demanda del nuevo siglo los corrales y otros edificios publicos y  viviendas de los empleados, acoto y tomo las medidas benevolentes para este fin.
					
					Le acompano el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita piscifactoria de Anbyon de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita piscifactoria de Anbyon de EPC
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la piscifactoria de Anbyon adscrita a la unidad 580 del EPC.
					En el criadero formado en septiembre del 1999 por la iniciativa del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, estan impregnadas las huellas de direccion de ese gran hombre dejadas durante su visita realizada en 15 de abril (Dia del Sol) de 2001 y en noviembre de 2011.
					
					Dando revista a varios puntos del criadero, el Mariscal averiguo detalladamente el estado de reconstruccion y la produccion de peces.
					
					Contemplando los estanques de peces acondicionados y edificios productivos formados a lo largo de canales de la laguna de donde brota el agua manantial, el Mariscal dijo con gran satisfaccion que se ha renovado radicalmente su fisonomia y se hizo mas pintoresco su paisaje para que sea unidad ejemplar y educadora de la piscifactoria de nuestro pais.
					
					Senalo levantar la imagen generosa del Dirigente en el recinto del criadero, producto de su amor por el pueblo y transmitirla generacion tras generacion.
					
					Observo atentamente el aspecto de los empleados que median en el tiempo real con computadoras en la sala de control general la temperatura de aguas, pH y la cantidad de oxigeno de los estanques y vigilaban con camaras submarinas el estado fisiologico de los peces.
					
					Acotando que se puede normalizar en la etapa alta la produccion solo cuando se logren la cientifizacion y la modernizacion de la acuicultura, dijo que la piscifactoria haya establecido bien el sistema de administracion combinada de acuerdo con el proposito del Partido.
					
					Tras examinar el aparato de tratamiento de agua instalado en la laguna, el Mariscal evaluo altamente los meritos de los cientificos e investigadores de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek quienes ayudaron activamente la modernizacion del criadero tales como el establecimiento del sistema de administracion combinada para que esta empresa lleve bien la acuicultura de manera cientifica.
					
					En la sala de incubacion, enseno que es bueno el hecho de que asegura por su propia cuenta los pececitos necesarios a la produccion al elevar al maximo su capacidad y los suministra a otras unidades. Al ver la laguna por gravedad, subrayo que se han construido excelentemente y no hay sitios vacios en el recinto.
					
					Instruyo emplear al maximo con eficacia la actual capacidad productiva y producir mucho los peces sabrosos y de seguridad higienica con los piensos nutritivos. 
					
					Los funcionarios y empleados de la piscifactoria deben cumplir el papel de vanguardia en el desarrollo de acuicultura del pais, ratifico y prosiguio que el partido enviara los medios de transporte y las instalaciones necesarios a la empresa.
					
					Le acompano el vicemariscal Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kim Kyok Sik
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kim Kyok Sik
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 11 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Kyok Sik, miembro del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del Ejercito Popular de Corea, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Putin
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Putin
Moscu, 9 de mayo (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien visito a Rusia para tomar parte en los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la victoria en la Gran Guerra Patria de Rusia, se reunio el dia 8 en el Gran Palacio de Kremlin con el presidente  de la Federacion Rusa, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin.
					En la ocasion Kim traslado el saludo que envia el Mariscal Kim Jong Un al mandatario ruso.
					
					Putin expreso profundo agradecimiento y encomendo al visitante que extendiera su saludo cordial al Mariscal.
					
					Kim Yong Nam entrego con cortesia un mensaje enviado por el Mariscal al presidente ruso.
					
					Putin expuso agradecimiento por el respecto.
					
					Kim Yong Nam y Putin intercambiaron las opiniones para ampliar y desarrollar en varios dominios como la politica, la economia y la cultura las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises que entran en una nueva etapa elevada.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien toma parte en los festejos del 70o aniversario de la victoria en la Gran Guerra Patria de Rusia, departio los dias 8 y 9 en Moscu con los jefes de Estado y Gobierno de varios paises.
					Kim Yong Nam departio con Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba.
					
					En la ocasion, Kim traslado con cortesia a Raul el saludo que le envia el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Raul expreso profundo agradecimiento por el respecto y encomendo a Kim que transmitiera su saludo sincero al Mariscal.
					
					Kim Yong Nam y Raul Castro Ruz intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo. 
					
					Ademas, Kim Yong Nam converso con Dmitri Medvedev, premier del gobierno de la Federacion Rusa.
					
					Medvedev dijo que el gobierno de la FR aprecia el desarrollo de relaciones con el gobierno de la RPDC y desea que todos marchen bien en ella. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam se reunio por separado con los presidentes de la Republica Sudafricana, Mongolia, la Republica Bolivariana de Venezuela, la Republica de Zimbabwe, la Republica Popular China, el Estado de Palestina, la Republica de Kazajstan, la Republica de Armenia, la Republica Arabe de Egipto y la Republica Socialista de Vietnam, el premier de gobierno de la Republica de Eslovaquia y otros jefes de Estado y el secretario general de la ONU.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam visita el Museo Central de Gran Guerra Patria
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam visita el Museo Central de Gran Guerra Patria
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien participa en los festejos del 70o aniversario de la victoria en la Gran Guerra Patria de Rusia, visito el dia 10 el Museo Central de la Gran Guerra Patria situado en Moscu.
					Kim y su comitiva recorrieron varios puntos del museo escuchando las explicaciones sobre los meritos heroicos del Ejercito Rojo y los pueblos quienes jugaron el papel decisivo en frustrar la agresion de la Alemania fascista y derrotar al fascismo.
					
					Kim firmo el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam regresa de Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam regresa de Rusia
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, y su comitiva regresaron el dia 11 luego de participar en los festejos del 70o aniversario de la victoria en la Gran Guerra Patria celebrados en Moscu.
					Ellos fueron acogidos por el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS, Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el vicecanciller Ri Kil Song y el embajador ruso en Corea Alexandr Matsegora.
